meanings.definition: To clothe or dress in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys beclothing her dolls in colorful outfits.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will beclothe the mannequin in the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The magician beclothed the rabbit in a tiny top hat and cape.
meanings.sent4: The artist beclothed the canvas with vibrant strokes of paint.
meanings.sent5: The mother beclothed her child in warm winter attire before heading out.

meanings.definition: To cover or adorn with clothing.
meanings.sent1: The snowstorm beclothed the town in a blanket of white.
meanings.sent2: The decorator will beclothe the room with elegant drapes.
meanings.sent3: The prankster beclothed the statue in a silly costume overnight.
meanings.sent4: The night sky beclothed with twinkling stars looked magical.
meanings.sent5: The garden beclothed in blooming flowers was a sight to behold.
